page.title: 02ST PAULS METHODIST CHURCH
page.content: Built in 1963 (the named slabs are from the 1926 building)the church and Sunday school have 100 chairs. The big pipe organ(c.1920) is from a theatre. 56 church members, 23 Sunday school scholars(& 5 leaders),1 minister who also looks after 6 others & a supernumerary.Services at 10.45 - 11.45 & 6.30-7.45 on Sundays.Youth club meets once a week, 20 members, 3 leaders.The church is run by a 10 member council with no head, meeting 2/3 times a year.Weddings and funerals are held with the minister. Lay preachers are relieved by minister once every 2 months.On slab outside is inscribed{"Primitive Methodist Chapel {1845."}Average attendance is 30/40. People from the boats attend when passing.Services last 1 hour. All windows are plain.Paul Whittaker left Â£7000 to the church hence the name.
